name: A Curatorial Perspective: Chay Reds, Ferrous Black
description:
Join us for a guided walk of our latest exhibition, “Chay Reds, Ferrous Black” with curator Yash Sanhotra. This exhibition reveals the untold stories of Indian textiles found in Sri Lanka. Featuring exquisite Palampores and textile fragments, dating back to the 18th century, they once graced humble homes as well as sacred temples. Today, they serve as storytellers, weaving together the rich and intricate history shared between two ancient cultures.

Whether you are fascinated by history, drawn to myths and legends, or a lover of textile craftsmanship, “Chay Reds, Ferrous Black” offers an evocative look into the ties that have bound India and Sri Lanka together for generations. Be a part of this interactive session and learn more about textiles and the tales they tell.

name: Block Printing Workshop (2:00 PM)
description: Join us for a hands-on block printing workshop with Pooja Gokul from Amoha Prints. Learn the ancient art of block printing, from its rich history and techniques to designing your own patterns and creating your own block-printed masterpiece. Whether you’re an artist or a beginner, this workshop offers an opportunity to explore your creativity and take home your own personalised print!

name: Notes from the Conservation Lab
description:
What goes on behind the scenes of an exhibition? Come find out in this guided tour of our latest exhibition, Chay Reds, Ferrous Black, where we focus on the meticulous process of textile conservation. Our conservators will share their expert insights into the techniques used to preserve and present these delicate artefacts. You’ll also have the opportunity to witness live demonstrations and ask questions about the challenges and processes of textile conservation.

 

This exhibition reveals the untold stories of Indian textiles found in Sri Lanka. Featuring exquisite Palampores and textile fragments, dating back to the 18th century. These once graced homes as well as sacred temples. Today, they serve as tools for storytelling, weaving together the rich and intricate history shared between two ancient cultures.

Note: There are only a few spots available for this event, so please book your spot as soon as possible.

name: Reader's Bloc: Soul Kitchen
description:
We are back! In this session we delve into the multifaceted nature of food and its influence in shaping one’s identity. We will be reading Vinay Kumar’s Blood Fry & Other Dalit Recipes from my Childhood which foregrounds the idea that along with a stark remembrance of taste, food carries with it memories of the past and an intersection with the present: What is their role in cultivating identity? Whose cultures and traditions are remembered and whose forgotten? Alongside this text, we explore Daisy Johnson's article Ritual, reflecting on the act of preparing, cooking and serving a dish, a process laden with emotion and rooted in familial and cultural heritage.

On registration, we will send you the text and the topics/themes we will discuss.

Reader’s Bloc is an online/IRL group of readers taking part in reading, listening and sharing exercises around texts that help us learn more about ourselves, the identities we share and the communities we live in.

This programme is exclusively for 18–25-year-olds. 

This session is conducted as part of our engagements for the MAP Youth Collective. The MAP Youth Collective is a community for young people (18-25 year-olds) to engage with the arts and culture sector. The collective is for, of and by young people — to explore our shared identities and interests through art.

name: Block Printing Workshop (11:30 AM)
description: Join us for a hands-on block printing workshop with Pooja Gokul from Amoha Prints. Learn the ancient art of block printing, from its rich history and techniques to designing your own patterns and creating your own block-printed masterpiece. Whether you’re an artist or a beginner, this workshop offers an opportunity to explore your creativity and take home your own personalised print!

name: Block Printing Workshop
description:
Join us for a hands-on block printing session, inspired by the hand-painted and printed textiles on view as part of our latest exhibition "Chay Reds, Ferrous Black".

Learn a little about this historical technique of creating intricate patterns on fabric using carved wooden blocks. Spend a little time experimenting with different colours and designs to create your own print and take home a piece of art with you!

This is a drop-in session from 11AM onwards with no prior registration required!

All materials will be provided. No prior art experience required.

name: Textile Story Trail: Chay Reds, Ferrous Black
description:
Calling all young adventurers!

Get ready to embark on a textile story trail! Our latest exhibition, Chay Reds, Ferrous Black, is an exhibition that reveals the untold stories of Indian textiles found in Sri Lanka.

Imagine these fabrics as tiny time capsules, telling us secrets about ancient trade routes, who made these textiles and how they were used. So what are you waiting for? Bring your friends and family and begin your adventure involving trade and textiles between India and the Pearl of the Indian Ocean, Sri Lanka. Join us on this guided journey and learn more about textiles and the tales they tell.

 

This event is for children and families.
